sense.name: have a great affection, liking, or desire for
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent[human]] LOVE NP2 NP1[agent[human]] LOVE COMP
sense.examples: I love you. Last night he told me he loved me. I'm sure he loves his kids. She loves animals. I absolutely love chocolate. He really loves his job. I love cooking. I'd love a cup of coffee if you're making one. I'd love for you to come to dinner tonight.

sense.name: thrive on, tend to, have the need
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1 LOVE NP2 NP1 LOVE COMP Note: NP1 is non-human.
sense.examples: The cactus loves hot, dry air. My car absolutely loves highways. This insect loves hiding in dark places.

sense.name: have sexual intercourse with
sense.examples: Lord, we loved all night the day before he left for Vietnam.
